awd_titl_txt: Instrument Development For X-ray Magnetic Circular Dichroism
awd_abstract_narration: We propose to develop an instrument for x-ray magnetic circular                 dichroism experiments on paramagnetic samples of bioinorganic                   interest.  It will record fluorescence-detected x-ray absorption                spectra (XAS) and x-ray magnetic circular dichroism (XMCD)                      measurements.  The device will be optimized for the vanadium                    through copper L-edges (500-1000 eV).  Preliminary experiments                  will be conducted on paramagentic V, Mn, Fe, Cu and Mo model                    compounds with known molecular structure and magnetic properties.               Crystallographically characterized small proteins such as azurin                and various ferrodoxins will also be examined.                                                                                                                  The x-ray sources and monochromators for this project are                       provided by national synchrotron radiation laboratories (NSLS and               SSRL).  Ultimately, the instrument will be used at the Advanced                 Light Source, a new high brightness soft x-ray ring under                       construction in Berkeley.
